result.execSummary:
The defendant Ricardo A. Gonzalez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (7th, 8th or 9th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS SHALL DEDUCT RESTITUTION AND ALL OTHER COURT OBLIGATIONS AT THE RATE OF 25% OF ALL MONIES RECEIVED WHILE INCARCERATED.
Concurrent with: Concurrent to Case #2015CF283 but Consecutive to 
Case #2015CF175

superMiscConds.notes: Pay $600.00 fine plus costs.   If the defendant is discharged from Extended Supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

No alcohol. 
-----------------------------
Not to enter any bars or liquor stores or other premises whose primary purpose is sales and service of alcohol.
-----------------------------
No illegal drugs drug paraphernalia. 
-----------------------------
Any prescription medications to be made know to Agent and taken as prescribed.
-----------------------------
No contact with known drug dealers.
-----------------------------

Psychological assessment and follow through with treatment.
-----------------------------
Cognitive behavioral treatment to address thought distortions and thinking errors.
-----------------------------
Compliance with additional rules or treatment.
-----------------------------
Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.
-----------------------------
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
-----------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
-----------------------------

*AMENDMENT 08/11/15 BOND NOW COVERS CASES 15CF175, 15CF283 & 15CF284*

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
